home.early_check: Early checks save lives — A small step today can make a big difference tomorrow, check your skin now!
home.survey_desc: To get even more accurate results, don't hesitate to answer the survey.
home.no_scans: No scans found. Take your first photo!
home.abcde_education: Educating yourself about the ABCDE rule is so crucial for early skin diagnosis.
home.enable_notifications: Please enable notifications in your phone settings.

header.notifications_desc: Manage how MelanoScan keeps you informed.
header.weekly_reminders_desc: Weekly nudges to check flagged lesions.

disclaimer.title: IMPORTANT DISCLAIMER
disclaimer.body: This app is a screening aid, <bold>NOT</bold> a diagnostic tool. Always consult a professional dermatologist for any skin concerns.
disclaimer.understanding_body: Early detection is a pivotal form of defense. Skin cancer is the abnormal growth of skin cells, most often developing on skin exposed to the sun. However, this common form of cancer can also occur on areas of your skin not ordinarily exposed to sunlight.
disclaimer.a_desc: One half of the mole does not match the other half.
disclaimer.b_desc: The edges are irregular, ragged, notched, or blurred.
disclaimer.c_desc: The color is not the same all over and may include shades of brown or black.
disclaimer.d_desc: The spot is larger than 6 millimeters across (about ¼ inch).
disclaimer.e_desc: The mole is changing in size, shape, or color over time.
disclaimer.vigilant_body: Perform regular self-checks on your skin. Look for new growths or existing moles that change. If you notice anything suspicious, book an appointment with a doctor immediately.
disclaimer.tip_1: Apply sunscreen (SPF 30+) every 2 hours when outdoors.
disclaimer.tip_2: Seek shade, especially between 10 AM and 4 PM.
disclaimer.tip_3: Avoid tanning beds and sunlamps entirely.
disclaimer.doctor_body:
You should consult a dermatologist if you notice:

1. A sore that doesn't heal.
2. Spread of pigment from the border of a spot into surrounding skin.
3. Redness or a new swelling beyond the border of the mole.
4. Change in sensation, such as itchiness, tenderness, or pain.

profile.logout_alert_body: Are you sure you want to log out? All local data will be cleared from this device for your privacy.

analysis_result.title: Analysing your photo
analysis_result.asymmetry_desc: If you draw a line through the mole and the two halves look very different, this uneven shape can be an early warning sign of melanoma.
analysis_result.border_desc: Melanomas often have uneven borders. Look for edges that are ragged, notched, or blurred.
analysis_result.color_desc: Benign moles are usually one shade. Melanomas may contain different shades of brown, black, or even red, white, or blue.
analysis_result.diameter_desc: Melanomas are usually larger than 6mm (roughly the size of a pencil eraser), though they can be smaller.
analysis_result.evolving_desc: Any change—in size, shape, color, elevation, or another trait, or any new symptom like bleeding, itching or crusting.
analysis_result.high_risk_desc: This lesion exhibits specific irregular features—such as asymmetry, border irregularity, or color variation—that are often associated with higher-risk conditions. We strongly advise that you schedule an appointment with a dermatologist for a professional evaluation and dermoscopic examination as soon as possible.
analysis_result.medium_risk_desc: The analysis detects some features that are ambiguous or deviate from a typical benign pattern. We suggest monitoring this spot closely for changes over the next few weeks and consulting a doctor if you notice any evolution.
analysis_result.low_risk_desc: Our AI analysis indicates that this spot currently displays benign characteristics typical of common moles. Although the risk appears minimal at this time, it is important to practice regular self-checks and monitor the area for any changes in size, shape, or color in the future.
analysis_result.advice_desc: If you ever feel unsure, don't hesitate to consult a healthcare professional.
analysis_result.uncertain_title: if you are uncertain or not convinced with the scan result, its totally fine - To make sure if its a mistake or not, you can:
analysis_result.ai_insight: Get tailored insights from our AI assistant. Click the robot to start a chat for more accurate guidance.
analysis_result.footer_disclaimer: This scan result is not a diagnosis. Please, consult a doctor for an accurate diagnosis and treatment recommendations

lesion_details.delete_confirm: Are you sure? This cannot be undone.

comparison_processing.title: Comparing Images
comparison_processing.asymmetry_desc: If you draw a line through the mole and the two halves look very different, this uneven shape can be an early warning sign of melanoma.
comparison_processing.footer_disclaimer: This scan result is not a diagnosis. Please, consult a doctor for an accurate diagnosis and treatment recommendations.
comparison_processing.non_comparable_msg: AI could not reliably compare these images. This can happen if the angles are very different or if they show different body parts. Please try again with more similar photos.

modal.title: Clinical Report Disclaimer
modal.body_intro: This report generates a visual summary of your skin lesion history to aid your doctor.
modal.point_1: • This document is <bold>NOT</bold> a medical diagnosis.
modal.point_2: • AI results are probabilistic and can be wrong.
modal.point_3: • Always consult a certified dermatologist for a physical examination.
modal.checkbox: I understand this report is for informational purposes only.

page1.title:
Catch Skin Changes 
Early!
page1.desc: Take a quick photo of your skin and let AI highlight potential risks. Early checks can make all the difference.

page2.title:
Your Health, Your 
 Privacy
page2.desc: All scans stay on your device. No internet needed, no data shared — your photos remain yours.

page3.title:
Stay on Top of Your 
 Skin Health
page3.desc: Track lesions over time, set reminders, and learn how to care for your skin with easy medical tips.
